answers.q: how many valence electrons does chlorine have

answers.a: No—chlorine is a nonmetal halogen (a greenish-yellow gas at room temperature).

answers.q: how long does chlorine rash last
answers.a: Irritant dermatitis from chlorine exposure typically clears within 1–3 days after avoiding further exposure; seek medical advice if it’s severe or persists.
No—head lice and their eggs generally survive typical swimming pool chlorine levels.

answers.q: how many electrons does chlorine have
answers.a: A neutral chlorine atom has 17 electrons; as chloride (Cl–) it has 18.
